ko:
A: 잘 지내시죠?
B: How's it going?

A: 그동안 잘 지내셨어요?
B: How have you been?

A: 여긴 어쩐 일이세요?
B: What brings you here?

A: 성함을 여쭤봐도 될까요?
B: May I ask your name?

A: 한국 음식 좋아하세요?
B: Do you like Korean food?

A: 커피나 차 중 어떤 걸 선호하시나요?
B: Are you a coffee person or a tea person?
en: Are you a coffee person or a tea person?

ko:
A: 이 동네/지역 분이신가요?
B: Are you from around here?

A: 이 동네에 사시나요?
B: Do you live in the neighborhood?
en: Do you live in the neighborhood?

ko:
A: 여가 시간에 뭐 하시나요?
B: What do you do in your spare time?
en: What do you do in your spare time?

ko:
A: 어떤 종류의 음악을 좋아하시나요?
B: What kind of music do you like?
en: What kind of music do you like?

ko:
A: 여행하는 거 좋아하세요?
B: Do you enjoy travelling?

A: 주로 혼자 여행하세요, 아니면 다른 분들과 여행하세요?
B: Do you usually travel alone or with others?
en: Do you usually travel alone or with others?

ko:
A: 요가를 해보신 적 있으신가요?
B: Have you ever tried yoga?

A: 얼마나 오래 해오셨나요?
B: How long have you been doing that?
en: How long have you been doing that?

ko:
A: 그걸 시작하게 된 계기가 있나요?
B: How did you get into that?
en: How did you get into that?

ko:
A: 가족분들은 어떻게 지내시나요?
B: How's your family?

A: 부모님께 안부 전해주세요.
B: Please say hello to your parents for me.
en: Please say hello to your parents for me.

ko:
A: 아내분은 어떻게 만났어요?
B: How did you meet your wife?
en: How did you meet your wife?

ko:
A: 얼마나 오래 만나신 건가요?
B: How long have you been together?
en: How long have you been together?

ko:
A: 형제/자매가 있으시나요?
B: Do you have any siblings?

A: 언니/여동생과 사이가 좋으신가요?
B: Are you close to your sister?
en: Are you close to your sister?

ko:
A: 자녀가 있으신가요?
B: Do you have any kids?

A: 반려동물이 있으신가요?
B: Do you have any pets?

A: 근처에서 근무하시나요?
B: Do you work nearby?

A: 하시는 일이 어떻게 되세요?
B: What do you do for a living?
en: What do you do for a living?

ko:
A: 여기에서 얼마나 근무하셨어요?
B: How long have you been working here?
en: How long have you been working here?

ko:
A: 거긴 마음에 드시나요?
B: Do you like it there?

A: 일은 어때요?
B: How's work?

A: 프로젝트는 어떻게 진행되어 가요?
B: How's your project going?

A: 출퇴근하는 데 얼마나 걸리나요?
B: How long is your commute to work?
en: How long is your commute to work?

ko:
A: Mia가 6월에 결혼한대요!
B: I heard that Mia is getting married in June!
en: I heard that Mia is getting married in June!

ko:
A: 새로 오신 매니저에 대해 어떻게 생각해요?
B: What do you think of the new manager?
en: What do you think of the new manager?

ko:
A: 몇 시에 퇴근하세요?
B: What time do you get off work?
en: What time do you get off work?

ko:
A: 퇴근 후 약속 있으세요?
B: Do you have any plans after work?
en: Do you have any plans after work?

ko:
A: 이번 주 가장 특별한 일이 뭐였나요?
B: What was the highlight of your week?
en: What was the highlight of your week?

ko:
A: 오늘 어땠어요?
B: It's been a long day.

A: 벌써 12월이네요!
B: I can't believe it's already December!
en: I can't believe it's already December!

ko:
A: 몇 시예요?
B: I lost track of time.

A: 학교는 어디에서 다녀요?
B: Where do you go to school?
en: Where do you go to school?

ko:
A: 전공이 뭐예요?
B: What do you study?

A: 왜 그 전공을 선택했어요?
B: What made you choose your major?
en: What made you choose your major?

ko:
A: 학교생활은 어때요?
B: How's school?

A: 몇 학년이에요?
B: What year are you?

A: 언제 졸업해요?
B: When do you graduate?

A: 졸업 후 계획이 있으신가요?
B: Do you have any plans after graduation?
en: Do you have any plans after graduation?

ko:
A: 기숙사에서 살아요?
B: Do you live in a dorm?
en: Do you live in a dorm?

ko:
A: 여름 방학에는 뭐 할 거예요?
B: What are you doing for summer break?
en: What are you doing for summer break?

ko:
A: 동아리 가입한 거 있어요?
B: Did you join any clubs?

A: 운동하는 거 있어요?
B: Do you play any sports?

A: 여기 와보신 적 있으세요?
B: Have you been here before?

A: 최근에 괜찮은 영화 보신 거 있으세요?
B: Have you seen any good movies lately?
en: Have you seen any good movies lately?

ko:
A: 영화에서 어떤 부분이 가장 마음에 드셨나요?
B: What was your favorite part of the movie?
en: What was your favorite part of the movie?

ko:
A: 그 영화에 누가 출연해요?
B: Who's in it?

A: 근처에 괜찮은 음식점 아시나요?
B: Do you know any good restaurants around here?
en: Do you know any good restaurants around here?

ko:
A: 여기서 거기까지 얼마나 걸려요?
B: How long does it take from here?
en: How long does it take from here?

ko:
A: 여기 경치 정말 좋죠?
B: Such a nice view!

A: 새 집은 어떻게 마음에 드세요?
B: How do you like your new place?
en: How do you like your new place?

ko:
A: 지난 휴가는 어디에 다녀오셨어요?
B: Where did you go on your last vacation?
en: Where did you go on your last vacation?

ko:
A: 지난 주말에 뭐 하셨어요?
B: What did you do last weekend?
en: What did you do last weekend?

ko:
A: 크리스마스 때 뭐 하실 거예요?
B: What are you doing for Christmas?
en: What are you doing for Christmas?

ko:
A: 벌써 1년이 지났네요.
B: Time flies.

A: 오늘이 금요일이에요!
B: The weekend is just around the corner.
en: The weekend is just around the corner.

ko:
A: 요즘 무슨 생각 하세요?
B: I miss college.

A: 이 노래 들으니까 어때요?
B: This reminds me of college.

A: 아직 Mia와 연락하세요?
B: Do you still talk to Mia?
en: Do you still talk to Mia?

ko:
A: 고등학교 때는 어땠어요?
B: I studied a lot when I was in high school.
en: I studied a lot when I was in high school.

ko:
A: 날씨 정말 좋네요!
B: Spring is in the air.

A: 오늘 날씨 어때요?
B: It's so hot. I'm melting!

A: 쇼핑 가시나요?
B: Are you going shopping?

A: 밖에 날씨 어때요?
B: It's freezing out there!

A: 여기 어떻게 생각하세요?
B: It's nice/fancy/cozy/huge.

A: 여긴 뭐가 맛있나요?
B: What's good here?

A: 무슨 냄새예요?
B: It smells good.

A: 파스타는 맛이 어때요?
B: How's your pasta?

A: 조금 드셔 보실래요?
B: Would you like to try some?
en: Would you like to try some?

ko:
A: 그거 맛있어 보이는데 뭔가요?
B: That looks good. What is it?
en: That looks good. What is it?

ko:
A: 직접 만드셨어요?
B: You're a great cook!

A: 카페 추천해 주세요.
B: You should check out that cafe.
en: You should check out that cafe.

ko:
A: 화장실이 어디에 있는지 아시나요?
B: Do you know where the restroom is?
en: Do you know where the restroom is?

ko:
A: 점심 식사는 맛있게 하셨나요?
B: Did you have a good lunch?
en: Did you have a good lunch?

ko:
A: 요즘 운동하세요?
B: Have you been working out?

A: 오늘 옷차림 어때요?
B: I like your dress.

A: 새 셔츠 어때요?
B: That shirt looks good on you.
en: That shirt looks good on you.

ko:
A: 그거 어디에서 사셨나요?
B: Where did you get it?

A: 나이가 어떻게 되세요?
B: You don't look a day over 35.
en: You don't look a day over 35.

ko:
A: 오랜만에 뵙는데 어떠세요?
B: You haven't changed a bit.

A: 헤어스타일 바꾸셨나요?
B: Did you change your hair?

A: 새 직장 구하신 거 축하드려요!
B: Congratulations on your new job.

A: 우연히 만나서 기뻐요!
B: I'm glad I ran into you!
en: I'm glad I ran into you!

ko:
A: 그 영화 어땠어요?
B: I saw that movie the other day.
en: I saw that movie the other day.

ko:
A: 오늘 많이 바쁘셨죠?
B: You must be tired.

A: Oliver는 어떻게 아세요?
B: How do you know Oliver?

A: 이런 행사에 와 보신 적 있으세요?
B: Have you been to an event like this before?
en: Have you been to an event like this before?

ko:
A: 즐거운 시간 보내고 계시나요?
B: Are you having a good time?
en: Are you having a good time?

ko:
A: 오늘 정말 덥네요.
B: Stay hydrated.

A: 내일 면접이 있어요.
B: I hope it goes well.

A: 새해 다짐을 무엇으로 정하셨나요?
B: What's your New Year's resolution?

A: 이제 가봐야 할 것 같아요.
B: It was nice talking to you.
en: It was nice talking to you.

ko:
A: 오늘 정말 즐거웠어요.
B: I enjoyed your company.

A: 언제 또 만나요.
B: Let's grab coffee sometime.

A: 연락하고 지내요.
B: Let's keep in touch.

A: 좋은 하루 보내세요!
B: Have a great day!

A: 주말 잘 보내세요!
B: Have a good weekend!

A: 안전하게 집에 들어가세요.
B: Get home safely.

A: 조심해서 가세요.
B: Drive safely.

A: 오늘 만나서 반가웠어요.
B: It was great meeting you today.
en: It was great meeting you today.

ko:
A: 나중에 또 봬요.
B: See you around.

A: 곧 다시 만나요.
B: See you soon.

A: 월요일에 봬요.
B: See you Monday.

A: 오늘 참석해 주셔서 감사합니다.
B: Thanks for coming today.

A: 초대해 주셔서 감사합니다.
B: Thanks for having me.

A: 도와주셔서 감사합니다.
B: Thanks for your help.

A: 어떻게 지내세요?
B: How are you doing?

A: 오늘 기분이 어떠세요?
B: How are you feeling today?

A: 건강하게 지내셨나요?
B: Have you been keeping well?

A: 요즘 어때요?
B: I've been better.

A: 요즘 힘드시죠?
B: I'm hanging in there.

A: 요즘 어떠세요?
B: I've been swamped.

A: 요즘 어떻게 지내요?
B: What have you been up to?
en: What have you been up to?

ko:
A: 뭐 하고 지내요?
B: Not much.

A: 요즘 뭐 해요?
B: Same old, same old.

A: 오랜만이에요!
B: Long time no see!

A: 정말 오랜만이네요!
B: It's been ages!

A: 여기서 만날 줄은 몰랐어요.
B: I didn't expect to see you here.
en: I didn't expect to see you here.

ko:
A: 여기서 웬일이세요?
B: What a pleasant surprise!

A: 처음 뵙겠습니다.
B: Nice to meet you.

A: 만나서 반갑습니다.
B: It's a pleasure to meet you.
en: It's a pleasure to meet you.

ko:
A: 저에 대해 들으셨나요?
B: I've heard a lot about you.
en: I've heard a lot about you.

ko:
A: 제 이야기 들으셨어요?
B: I've heard great things about you.
en: I've heard great things about you.

ko:
A: 뭐라고 부르면 될까요?
B: What should I call you?

A: 어떻게 불러드릴까요?
B: Just call me John.

A: 저도 그래요!
B: Same here!

A: 저도 마찬가지예요.
B: Me too.

A: 저도 그런 경험 있어요.
B: I can totally relate.

A: 정말 힘들었어요.
B: I can imagine.

A: 이해가 되시나요?
B: That makes sense.

A: 제 생각은 이래요.
B: That's a good point.

A: 이런 방법은 어때요?
B: I never thought of it that way.
en: I never thought of it that way.

ko:
A: 이거 알아요?
B: That's interesting!

A: 정말요?
B: Really?

A: 진짜요?
B: No way!

A: 농담이시죠?
B: Are you serious?

A: 정말이에요?
B: I can't believe it.

A: 이거 봤어요?
B: That's amazing!

A: 이거 어떻게 한 거예요?
B: That's impressive!

A: 정말 멋지네요!
B: That's awesome!

A: 잘됐네요!
B: That's great!

A: 승진했어요!
B: Good for you!

A: 시험에 떨어졌어요.
B: I'm sorry to hear that.

A: 계획이 취소됐어요.
B: That's too bad.

A: 요즘 힘들어요.
B: Hang in there.

A: 걱정돼요.
B: It'll work out.

A: 걱정 마세요.
B: Don't worry about it.

A: 미안해요.
B: It's okay.

A: 문제없어요.
B: No problem.

A: 정말 감사합니다.
B: Don't mention it.

A: 도와주셔서 정말 고마워요.
B: It's nothing.

A: 제가 계산할게요.
B: It's on me.

A: 제가 살게요.
B: My treat.

A: 오늘은 제가 낼게요.
B: I'll get the next one.

A: 각자 내요.
B: Let's split the bill.

A: 배고프지 않으세요?
B: Aren't you hungry?

A: 배고프세요?
B: I'm starving.

A: 더 드실래요?
B: I'm stuffed.

A: 물 드릴까요?
B: I'm thirsty.

A: 물 한 잔 마실래요?
B: Would you like some water?

A: 뭐 마실 거 있어요?
B: Can I get you something to drink?
en: Can I get you something to drink?

ko:
A: 더 드실래요?
B: I'm good, thanks.

A: 괜찮으세요?
B: I'm fine.

A: 얼마나 드릴까요?
B: Just a little.

A: 더 드릴까요?
B: That's enough, thank you.

A: 괜찮으세요?
B: You look tired.

A: 잘 주무셨나요?
B: Did you sleep well?

A: 왜 그렇게 피곤해 보이세요?
B: I didn't sleep well last night.
en: I didn't sleep well last night.

ko:
A: 좀 쉬는 게 어때요?
B: Why don't you take a break?
en: Why don't you take a break?

ko:
A: 왜 그러세요?
B: I need a break.

A: 언제 휴가 가세요?
B: I need a vacation.

A: 스트레스 받으세요?
B: Are you stressed out?

A: 요즘 어때요?
B: I've been stressed lately.

A: 뭐 하실 거예요?
B: I need to clear my head.
en: I need to clear my head.

ko:
A: 날씨가 정말 좋네요!
B: What beautiful weather!

A: 오늘 날씨 어때요?
B: The weather is perfect.

A: 오늘 뭐 할 거예요?
B: It's a great day to be outside.
en: It's a great day to be outside.

ko:
A: 저 하늘 좀 봐요.
B: It looks like it's going to rain.
en: It looks like it's going to rain.

ko:
A: 우산 가져오셨나요?
B: Did you bring an umbrella?

A: 오늘 날씨 어때요?
B: How's the weather today?

A: 꽃가루 알레르기 있으세요?
B: Do you have allergies?

A: 어느 계절을 제일 좋아하세요?
B: Spring is my favorite season.

A: 여름이 기다려지세요?
B: I can't wait for summer.

A: 가을 단풍 보러 가실래요?
B: The fall colors are beautiful.

A: 겨울 좋아하세요?
B: Winter is too cold for me.
en: Winter is too cold for me.

ko:
A: 눈 오는 거 좋아하세요?
B: Do you like snow?

A: 오늘 출근 어땠어요?
B: The traffic is terrible.

A: 출근길이 어땠어요?
B: How was your commute?

A: 보통 어떻게 출근하세요?
B: How do you usually get to work?
en: How do you usually get to work?

ko:
A: 어떻게 다니세요?
B: I take the subway.

A: 집이 가까우신가요?
B: I walk.

A: 출근하세요?
B: I work from home.

A: 재택근무가 어때요?
B: How do you like working from home?
en: How do you like working from home?

ko:
A: 재택근무는 어떤가요?
B: It has its pros and cons.
en: It has its pros and cons.
